Stöd till BMP (2018 - 2022)
Bangladesh Mahila Parishad (BMP) är en volontärbaserad icke-statlig organisation i Bangladesh som arbetar för kvinnors rättigheter. Organisationen bildades i Dhaka 1970 för att arbeta för kvinnors frigörelse. BMP har mer än 150 000 medlemmar och mer än 2000 gräsrotsnivåkommittéer utspridda över hela landet. Dess medlemmar kommer från alla samhällsskikt och består av alltifrån utbildade professionella kvinnor till lantbruksarbetande kvinnor.
BMP: s föreslagna projekt för perioden 2018-2022 syftar till att gradvis bidra till att minska alla former av könsbaserad diskriminering i Bangladesh genom att implementera genderfrågor i utvecklingsagendan efter 2015.
Det finns tre huvudmål som programmet kommer att arbeta för att uppnå: 1. Främja och skydda kvinnors mänskliga rättigheter, motstå alla former av våld mot kvinnor och flickor. 2. Främjande av kvinnors mänskliga rättigheter och arbeta för effektivt och meningsfullt deltagande av kvinnor i politiska processer och beslutsfattande för att stärka demokratin och god samhällsstyrning 3. Förstärkning och konsolidering av BMP: s kapacitet
Sverige har indikativt beslutat om stöd till projektet med en sammanlagd summa på 25 000 000 kronor.

Support to BMP (2018 - 2022)
Bangladesh Mahila Parishad (BMP) is a volunteer-based non-governmental organization in Bangladesh working for women’s rights. The organisation was established in Dhaka in 1970 to work for the emancipation of women. BMP has more than 150,000 members and more than 2000 grassroots level committees spread all over the country. Its members come from all walks of life and consist of urban educated professional women to the rural agricultural workers.
BMP's proposed project for the period 2018-2022 aims to incrementally contribute to reduce all forms of gender based discrimination in Bangladesh by engendering the post 2015 development agenda.
There are three main objectives that the programme will work towards: 1. Promote and protect women's human rights, resisting all forms of violence against women and girls. 2. Advocacy lobby for women's human rights and effective and meaningful participation of women in political process and decision making towards strengthening democracy and good governance 3. Strengthening and consolidating capacity of BMP
Sweden has indicated support to the Project with a total allocation of SEK 25 000 000.

5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.

5.c - Adopt and strengthen sound policies and enforceable legislation for the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls at all levels.
5.c - Anta och stärka välgrundad politik och genomförbar lagstiftning för att främja jämställdhet och öka alla kvinnors och flickors egenmakt på alla nivåer

description.narrative:
During 2021 and like many other countries around the world, Bangladesh continued to be affected by the repercussions of the Covid-19 pandemic in terms of health, livelihoods, unemployment, multidimensional poverty, education and overall progress. While the general public strove to adjust to the new normal, it was the women and girls from different societal classes who faced serious challenges in various forms. Overall safety issues of women and girls deteriorated - in both private and public spheres. Gender based violence continued to be on the rise with the number of rape incidences including child rape, raising alarm in society.
Many women working in the informal sector lost their employment and have had to face severe economic crises. As education institutions were closed for prolonged periods, young girls confined in houses were engaged in domestic work; many of them subjected to violence and sexual abuse; and a large number became victims of forced marriage. The overall situation did not allow for issues of political empowerment of women and their representation to be stressed during this period. Incidences of human rights violations continued at an alarming rate and the overall negative trends may have contributed to an even more restricted democratic space with enforcement of law and order seen to backslide.
Despite the challenging external environment during the period, BMP was able to sustain their efforts and implement most of the planned activities with slight revision in their timeline.
To address one of its main objectives Promote and Protect Womens Human Rights Resisting all Forms of Violence Against Women and Girls during the reporting period, BMP was able to continue the important work of advocating for law reform to establish gender justice.
Advocacy for law reform that BMP has been part of in 2021:
- Introduction of Uniform Family Court
- Reform of Women and Children Repression Prevention Act -2000
- Reform of Rape Law
- Reform of Evidence Act 1872
- Introduction of Witness Protection Law
- Introduction of Anti-discriminatory Law
- Sexual Harassment Prevention Law
- Reform of Hindu Family Law
- Enforcement and Reform of Digital Security Act 2018
- Introduction of Equal Inheritance Law
- Repeal of Special Provision of Child Marriage Restraint Act 2017
BMP also provided rehabilitation service for victims of violence including medical care; they provided legal advice including settlement and/or mediation, and conducted court cases on behalf of the victims.
Advocacy Lobby for Women Human Rights and Effective and Meaningful Participation of Women in Political Process and Decision Making Towards Strengthening Democracy and Good Governance is another objective of the project in which BMP strongly advocated (a) to include women in the local government; and (b) to include women representatives in the national Covid Management and Planning Implementation Committee.
During 2021, BMP was engaged in advocacy and lobby by expressing serious concern of different incidents of VAWG, repression on freedom of expression, and violation of human rights among others. BMP has also submitted memorandums and petitions to concerned authorities demanding neutral investigation and justice for victims.
Impact of Project Activities:
Some of the specific areas of changes perceived as a result of BMPs persistent involvement in women issues through different activities have been identified as follows:
- Social movement in resisting violence against women (VAW) has been accelerated
- Networking with other organizations is extended and strengthened
- Government/NGO collaboration strengthened and working relation improved
- BMPs statistics and publications are used as reference by media, researchers, and academia
- Engagement of different professional group in BMPs programme enhanced
- Organizational expansion at the grass root level
- Group of young leadership developed in all tiers of BMP
- Positive impact on organizational management through building divisional leadership
- Awareness and motivation for volunteerism towards women rights movement increasing in the society
- Effective networking with media
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
